channel.title: Major Digest - Reliable and Comprehensive News Sources: us
channel.description: Get the latest news online at Major Digest, the top online news resource for the most reliable news sources. Stay informed about the world around you!

image.title: Major Digest - Reliable and Comprehensive News Sources: us

item.title: Furloughed federal workers face delays getting unemployment pay during shutdown
item.description: Thousands of furloughed federal workers are trying to navigate the unemployment system, in a sharp increase that is still a fraction of the 670,000 furloughed during the shutdown.
item.dc:creator: Jonathan Mattise, Associated Press, Local 4

item.title: With pharaoh-fanfare, Egypt unveils a huge new museum dedicated to its ancient civilization
item.description: CAIRO (AP) — Egypt on Saturday was inaugurating the long-delayed Grand Egyptian Museum, the world’s largest museum dedicated to an ancient civilization — a megaproject also aimed at boosting the country’s tourism industry and troubled economy.
item.dc:creator: SAMY MAGDY, Associated Press, PHL 17

item.title: New-look Dodgers lineup only produces 4 hits but they come at right time as LA forces Game 7
item.description: TORONTO (AP) — A new-look lineup for the Los Angeles Dodgers only produced four hits in Game 6, but three of them came in a three-run rally off Blue Jays starter Kevin Gausman.
item.dc:creator: IAN HARRISON, Associated Press, Fox 5

item.title: Federal judge rules Trump can’t require citizenship proof on the federal voting form
item.description: NEW YORK (AP) — President Donald Trump’s request to add a documentary proof of citizenship requirement to the federal voter registration form cannot be enforced, a federal judge ruled Friday. U.S. District Judge Colleen Kollar-Kotelly in Washington, D.C.
item.dc:creator: ALI SWENSON and NICHOLAS RICCARDI, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: New York Attorney General Letitia James seeks to block Trump administration's subpoenas
item.description: New York Attorney General Letitia James is challenging the legitimacy of the acting U.S. attorney in Albany as she pushes back against the Trump administration's investigation of cases she brought against the president and the National Rifle Association, according to court documents unsealed Friday.
item.dc:creator: CAROLYN THOMPSON, Associated Press, KTLA 5

item.title: Air traffic controller shortages lead to broader US flight delays as shutdown nears one-month mark
item.description: Travel delays were adding up at airports across the U.S. on Friday as the government shutdown drags on, putting even more pressure on air traffic controllers who have been working without pay for a month. U.S.
item.dc:creator: RIO YAMAT, Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: President Trump returns to '60 Minutes' for first time after settling lawsuit against newsmagazine
item.description: President Donald Trump is returning to “60 Minutes” this weekend, his first appearance on the show since he settled a lawsuit this summer with CBS News over the newsmagazine's interview with Kamala Harris.
item.dc:creator: DAVID BAUDER, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Multiple people have been arrested in Michigan in a Halloween weekend attack plot, FBI director says
item.description: DEARBORN, Mich. (AP) — Multiple people who had been allegedly plotting a violent attack over the Halloween weekend were arrested Friday in Michigan, FBI Director Kash Patel said in a social media post. The law enforcement effort was focused on suburban Detroit.
item.dc:creator: MIKE HOUSEHOLDER and ERIC TUCKER, Associated Press, KLAS, CBS News

item.title: Utah redistricting battle: Small city split into four congressional districts
item.description: The city's division means residents can cross different congressional districts simply by visiting nearby businesses.
item.dc:creator: Brian Entin, NewsNation

item.title: FBI confirms death, injury count in Michigan church shooting
item.description: The Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) has confirmed the number of dead and injured in the shooting at an LDS church in Grand Blanc, Mich., in Sept.
item.dc:creator: Ryan Bittan, ABC 4

item.title: Blood pressure medication recalled over potential carcinogen: What to know
item.description: Nearly 590,000 bottles of blood pressure drugs have been recalled over concerns that they may contain a potentially carcinogenic chemical that exceeds the “acceptable intake limit.
item.dc:creator: Michael Bartiromo, Fox 5

item.title: Trump urged GOP-led states to redraw US House districts. Now other states also are gerrymandering
item.description: President Donald Trump's call for Republicans to redraw U.S. House districts ahead of next year's election has triggered an unusual outbreak of mid-decade gerrymandering among both Republican- and Democratic-led states.
item.dc:creator: DAVID A. LIEB, Associated Press, KLAS, CBS News

item.title: South Carolina man chooses execution by firing squad despite concerns over last death by bullets
item.description: COLUMBIA, S.C. (AP) — A man on death row in South Carolina who taunted investigators with messages written with a victim's blood chose Friday to die by firing squad. Stephen Bryant, 44, will be the third man this year to die by South Carolina's newest execution method. His execution is set for Nov.
item.dc:creator: JEFFREY COLLINS, Associated Press, KLAS, CBS News

item.title: Virginia Senate approves Democrat-led redistricting amendment
item.description: The party has to pass the amendment in the state legislature one more time before it can be teed up before the public for a vote.
item.dc:creator: Caroline Vakil, NewsNation

item.title: 70 years after the first sabotage of a US airliner, the 44 killed are finally being honored
item.description: LONGMONT, Colo. (AP) — The windows shook as dynamite aboard an airplane exploded over Conrad Hopp's family farm in northern Colorado 70 years ago.
item.dc:creator: COLLEEN SLEVIN, Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: JetBlue flight to New Jersey makes emergency descent, injuring as many as 20 passengers
item.description: Fifteen to 20 passengers were injured on a JetBlue flight heading to Newark, New Jersey. The flight was diverted in Florida due to a control issue experienced by the flight crew, according to officials.
item.dc:creator: Matthew Euzarraga, Fox 5

item.title: The Latest: Trump administration must fund SNAP payments during the shutdown, judges rule
item.description: Federal judges have ruled that the Trump administration must continue funding SNAP during the government shutdown.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, KPRC 2

item.title: With fragile Gaza ceasefire holding, Trump wants to make headway on Indonesia-Israel normalization
item.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — President Donald Trump made sure during his visit to Asia this week to praise regional allies who have backed his push to bring about a permanent end to the Israel-Hamas war.
item.dc:creator: AAMER MADHANI and EDNA TARIGAN, Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: Republicans battling behind scenes over funding SNAP during shutdown
item.description: Cracks are forming in the Senate GOP conference over whether benefits under the Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (SNAP) should be allowed to lapse this weekend.
item.dc:creator: Alexander Bolton, KRON4

item.title: DC Mayor Bowser says residents will receive SNAP, WIC benefits in November
item.description: Washington, D.C., Mayor Muriel Bowser (D) on Thursday said the city will fund the Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (SNAP) and the separate program for Women, Infants, and Children (WIC) for the month of November amid the government shutdown.
item.dc:creator: Ashleigh Fields, KRON4

item.title: Palestinian militants hand over remains of two more hostages to Red Cross in Gaza
item.description: JERUSALEM (AP) — Hospital officials in Gaza say that Israel has handed over the bodies of 30 Palestinians. Friday's handover comes a day after Palestinian militants in Gaza turned over the remains of two hostages to Israel.
item.dc:creator: JULIA FRANKEL and WAFAA SHURAFA, Associated Press, KTLA 5

item.title: Trump says Senate should scrap the filibuster to end the government shutdown
item.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — President Donald Trump is calling on the Senate to scrap the filibuster, so that the Republican majority can bypass Democrats and reopen the federal government.
item.dc:creator: LISA MASCARO AP Congressional Correspondent, WFLA, NBC

item.title: Dallas-native pulls 1-of-1 Shohei Ohtani autograph on spontaneous card shop trip after father has a stroke
item.description: (WGN) — In the grand scheme of things, Rick Fayter and his son are a lot like other father-son duos across the country.
item.dc:creator: Eli Ong, WGN 9

item.title: RFK Jr. says no 'sufficient' evidence Tylenol definitively causes autism
item.description: Health and Human Services Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. said there is not “sufficient” evidence that Tylenol causes autism, softening warnings he and President Trump have repeatedly made to discourage the medicine's use by pregnant women and young children.
item.dc:creator: Nathaniel Weixel, NewsNation

item.title: King Charles III strips Prince Andrew of titles and evicts him from royal residence
item.description: King Charles III is stripping his brother Prince Andrew of his remaining titles and evicting him from his royal residence, Buckingham Palace said Thursday.
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press, Fox 5

item.title: Federal government shutdown threatens SNAP food aid as several states scramble to help
item.description: With federal SNAP food assistance set to run dry this weekend amid the protracted U.S. government shutdown, Louisiana, New Mexico and Vermont became the latest states Wednesday to announce help for low-income households that rely on the funds to eat.
item.dc:creator: MARGERY A. BECK and GEOFF MULVIHILL, Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: Hurricane Melissa leaves trail of destruction across Cuba, Haiti and Jamaica
item.description: SANTIAGO DE CUBA, Cuba (AP) — Hurricane Melissa left at least dozens dead and caused widespread destruction across Cuba, Haiti and Jamaica, where roofless homes, toppled utility poles and water-logged furniture dominated the landscape Wednesday.
item.dc:creator: ARIEL FERNÁNDEZ, ANDREA RODRÍGUEZ, JOHN MYERS JR. and EVENS SANON Associated Press, WFLA, NBC

item.title: Hurricane Melissa leaves trail of destruction across Cuba, Haiti and Jamaica
item.description: SANTIAGO DE CUBA, Cuba (AP) — Hurricane Melissa left at least dozens dead and caused widespread destruction across Cuba, Haiti and Jamaica, where roofless homes, toppled utility poles and water-logged furniture dominated the landscape Wednesday.
item.dc:creator: ARIEL FERNÁNDEZ, ANDREA RODRÍGUEZ, JOHN MYERS JR. and EVENS SANON, Associated Press, KTLA 5

item.title: JD Vance calls for reduction in legal immigration at Turning Point event
item.description: Vice President JD Vance advocated a slowdown in legal immigration Wednesday, saying, “We have to get the overall numbers way, way down.
item.dc:creator: JONATHAN J. COOPER, Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: Suspected killer loose after being mistakenly released from California jail
item.description: A suspected killer remains at-large after he was mistakenly released from jail in California, the Contra Costa County Sheriff's Office said. The man's whereabouts are unknown.
item.dc:creator: Amy Larson, WGN 9

item.title: Judge's order blocking removal of man from US wasn't received until after he was deported, DHS says
item.description: NEW ORLEANS (AP) — Immigration authorities did not receive word of a court order blocking the removal of a man living in Alabama until after he had been deported to Laos, the U.S. Department of Homeland Security said Wednesday, dismissing claims that officials violated the order.
item.dc:creator: JIM MUSTIAN and JACK BROOK, Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: Media coalition sues Tennessee prison officials to get more access to executions
item.description: A coalition of news organizations including The Associated Press is suing Tennessee’s top prisons official and a warden, alleging state execution protocols unconstitutionally limit the media's access and hamper thorough and accurate reporting.
item.dc:creator: ADRIAN SAINZ, Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: Illinois deputy found guilty of second-degree murder of Sonya Massey
item.description: The trial for Sean Grayson, the former Illinois sheriff's deputy accused of killing 36-year-old Sonya Massey, ended with a conviction of second-degree murder.
item.dc:creator: Brandon Merano, ABC 4

item.title: Character.AI to ban children from talking with chatbots
item.description: “We’re making these changes to our under-18 platform in light of the evolving landscape around AI and teens,” the company said in a blog post, underscoring recent news reports and questions from regulators.
item.dc:creator: Julia Shapero, Fox 5

item.title: HHS fires top official who was critical of COVID shots
item.description: The Trump administration over the weekend fired Steven Hatfill, a senior advisor to the administration who opposed the COVID-19 vaccines and promoted the use of hydroxychloroquine during the pandemic.
item.dc:creator: Joseph Choi, WGN 9

item.title: The East Wing demolition was 'jarring.' But a White House history buff sees a silver lining
item.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — Stewart McLaurin knew it was coming. An entire wing of the White House, a building he calls “the most special, important building on the planet,” was going to be replaced to make way for a ballroom that President Donald Trump wants to add to the building.
item.dc:creator: DARLENE SUPERVILLE, Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: Shutdown pain spikes this weekend, upping pressure on Congress to strike deal
item.description: The shutdown pain is set to spiral. After four weeks in which the real-world impacts of the budget impasse have been relatively limited, a series of deadlines governing a range of programs will converge at the turn of the month to send the effects of the shutdown well beyond the Beltway.
item.dc:creator: Mike Lillis, WGN 9
